entropy - The tendency for all matter and energy in the universe to evolve toward a state of inert uniformity. My envisioning of it works like this. In short From the "big Bang" you start out with a type of "plasma" for a lack of a better word. This plasma "condenses" into the first atoms. Those nebula of atoms condensed into stars. At every stage the parts of the whole are shrinking or condensing. As energy levels uniformly drop is matter still condensing? uniformly "shrinking" all matter?

I've always found the phrases "dark matter" and "dark energy" very misleading, as if they're actual things and/or energy. @IzzaCooks1 the universe is expanding the reason we know this is true is because when we look into the sky everything is tinted slightly red the reason that that is significant is because it is similar to the Doppler effect that occurs on sound waves as something approaches you the waves become pushed together and as the object making the sound or light moves away from you the waves become more spread out meaning that everything will look closer to the red spectrum when stuff is moving away
